description: A 450-meter long, 27-meter wide pedestrian boulevard opened in 2007, linking Abovyan Street with Freedom Square. The avenue features luxurious residential buildings covered in pink tuff and travertine, housing international fashion brands, restaurants, cafes, and nightclubs.
highlights: International luxury brands including Burberry, Armani, Massimo Dutti, Ralph Lauren
Underground Tashir Street Shopping Gallery with massive parking area
Street musicians, painters, mimes, and creative performers on summer evenings
Designed by architect Alexander Tamanyan as part of early 20th century city plan
Bustling cafes and restaurants including Cinnabon, Pizza Hut, and KFC
tips: Perfect for evening strolls and people-watching
Connects Cascade Complex to Republic Square - ideal walking route
High-end shopping with mix of international and local brands
Benches available for sitting and observing city life
Warm summer evenings offer best atmosphere with street performers
vibe: Cosmopolitan and elegant, a modern pedestrian promenade where Yerevan's contemporary urban culture thrives amid beautiful architecture and lively social energy
